events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection. Immediate claim filing was requested due to extensive damage.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident as the incident involved a collision between two vehicles on public roads.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to begin processing and assist the claimant with next steps in the settlement.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed the initiation of the investigation process.
Documents requested from the claimant include the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and the driver’s license.
The claimant submitted all required documents, including official accident reports and photographic evidence of the vehicle damage.
Investigation into the claim began, focusing on verifying liability and assessing the extent of damage to the vehicle.
The investigator completed the assessment, confirming the collision details and estimating repair costs for the claimant’s vehicle.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering vehicle repair expenses and related costs based on investigation findings.
The claimant responded positively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the compensation amount.
The claim was officially approved following the claimant’s acceptance of the settlement terms and confirmation of document completeness.
The settlement payment was issued to the claimant’s account to cover the agreed vehicle repair costs promptly.
The claim case was closed officially after successful payment issuance and confirmation of the claimant’s satisfaction with the process.
The claim file was archived in the insurance system for future reference and record-keeping purposes.
